briefdescription.para: Uses the combination of all filters.

memberdef.name: BT_SCAN_CB_INIT
memberdef.initializer: static const struct cb_data _name ## _data = { \ .filter_match = match_fun, \ .filter_no_match = no_match_fun, \ .connecting_error = error_fun, \ .connecting = connecting_fun, \ }; \ static struct bt_scan_cb _name = { \ .cb_addr = &_name ## _data, \ }

detaileddescription.para: This is macro initializing necessary structures for bt_scan_cb type.

parameterdescription.para: Scan filter unmatched (the device was not found) function pointer.

detaileddescription.para: Active scanning.
Passive scanning.
Filter for names.
Filter for short names.
Filter for addresses.
Filter for UUIDs.
Filter for appearances.
Filter for manufacturer data.
Register callbacks to monitor the state of scanning.

briefdescription.para: Function for initializing the Scanning Module.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to scanning module initialization structure. Can be initialized as NULL. If NULL, the parameters required to initialize the module are loaded from static configuration. If module is to establish the connection automatically, this must be initialized with the relevant data.

detaileddescription.para: This function starts the scanning according to the configuration set during the initialization.

parameterdescription.para: The choice between active and passive scanning.

simplesect.para: 0 If the operation was successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: Function to update initial connection parameters.

simplesect.para: The function should not be used when scanning is active.

detaileddescription.para: The filters can be combined with each other. For example, you can enable one filter or several filters. For example, (BT_SCAN_NAME_FILTER | BT_SCAN_UUID_FILTER) enables UUID and name filters.

parameterdescription.para: If this flag is set, all types of enabled filters must be matched before generating BT_SCAN_EVT_FILTER_MATCH to the main application. Otherwise, it is enough to match one filter to trigger the filter match event.

simplesect.para: 0 If the operation was successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

detaileddescription.para: This function disables all filters. Even if the automatic connection establishing is enabled, the connection will not be established with the first device found after this function is called.
This function returns the filter setting and whether it is enabled or disabled.

simplesect.para: 0 If the operation was successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: Function for adding any type of filter to the scanning.

detaileddescription.para: This function adds a new filter by type. The filter will be added if there is available space in this filter type array, and if the same filter has not already been set.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to The filter data to add.

simplesect.para: 0 If the operation was successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: Function for removing all set filters.

detaileddescription.para: The function removes all previously set filters.

simplesect.para: After using this function the filters are still enabled.

briefdescription.para: Function for changing the scanning parameters.

detaileddescription.para: Use this function to change scanning parameters. During the parameter change the scan is stopped. To resume scanning, use bt_scan_start. Scanning parameters can be set to NULL. If so, the default static configuration is used.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to Scanning parameters. Can be initialized as NULL.

simplesect.para: 0 If the operation was successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

detaileddescription.para: Use this function to remove all entries from the connection attempts filter.

briefdescription.para: Add a new device to the blocklist.

detaileddescription.para: Use this function to add a device to the blocklist. Scanning module does not generate any event for the blocklist device or does not try to connect such devices.

parameterdescription.para: If the operation was successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: Clear the blocklist of the scanning module device.

detaileddescription.para: Use this function to remove all entries from the blocklist.
